title: With Nord Stream 2 Freeze, Germany Takes First Step to Cut Russian Gas Reliance
sub_head: Vladimir Putin’s aggression in Ukraine triggers a search for other natural-gas supplies, but it could take years for Berlin to wean itself off Russian imports
body:
Germany’s decision to halt its Nord Stream 2 natural-gas pipeline to Russia, prompted by Russian President Vladimir Putin’s recognition of two breakaway regions in eastern Ukraine, marks a turning point for the country.
Both decisions—prompted by Russian President Vladimir Putin’s recognition of two breakaway regions in eastern Ukraine—mark a turning point for Germany. After three decades of successive governments tying their country’s energy market to supplies from Russia, Berlin is now urgently reconsidering in a shift that could inflict high costs on its economy.
